newsitem.title: USA: Fed's FOMC begins meeting 0900 EST/1400 GMT.
newsitem.headline: Fed's FOMC begins meeting 0900 EST/1400 GMT.

text.p: The Federal Reserve's policysetting Federal Open Market Committee was scheduled to begin meeting at 9 a.m. EST (1400 GMT), a Fed spokesman said on Tuesday, as expectations mounted that it may raise short-term interest rates for the first time in two years.
Financial markets were strong on Monday, anticipating only a modest increase in rates. The FOMC is expected to announce its rate decision sometime around 2:15 p.m. (1915 GMT).

The Fed has not raised rates since February 1995. But Fed Chairman Alan Greenspan told Congress's Joint Economic Committee last week that labor markets were tight and the central bank must keep a lid on inflation pressures in order to sustain the economy's expansion.
